weather_report: Albany wakes cool and damp before dawn, last evening’s light rain still beading the sidewalks and softening the streetlights. Skies look stubborn and low, with only a shy chance of thinning later; sunshine, if it peeks through, will be fleeting, and the UV stays tame. Expect a muted, slate-gray day with occasional spit of drizzle and long spells of quiet, dry air—more cozy than sparkling, but gentle on the nerves. A light rain jacket and easy layers will serve you well, with shoes that don’t mind puddles and a fold-up umbrella for insurance. It’s a good hour to brew something warm, sort the week’s list, water the plants, or step out for a short errand between showers; later, a calm visit to the library or a brisk lap around the block suits the mood.
